intro: Eutacta rulei var. polymorpha, commonly known as the variable eutacta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
